synthesis_steps: H2L (200 mg, 0.520 mmol) was dissolved in water (2 mL) and sonicated for 5 minutes.
EuCl3 x 6H2O (63.55 mg, 0.173 mmol) was dissolved in water (2 mL) and sonicated for 5 minutes.
The two solutions were mixed and warmed on a heating mantle for 10 minutes.
BaCl2 x 2H2O (84.74 mg, 0.347 mmol) was dissolved in water (5 mL).
The barium solution was mixed with the warm europium(III) tris(4,4’-disulfonate 2,2’-bipyridine 1,1’-dioxide) solution, forming a white precipitate.
Single crystals were grown by vapor diffusion using 2-3 mL of the final solution mixture and acetone as the diffusing solvent.

xray_crystallography_info.atom_location: Europium, barium, and sulfur atoms located first; remaining atoms found by difference Fourier maps
xray_crystallography_info.hydrogen_atoms: Calculated in ideal positions; occupancy of one H atom set to zero for coordinated water molecules

synthesis_info.notes: Upon dehydration, the solid becomes highly hygroscopic and rapidly absorbs moisture from the air. The IR and thermal analyses are consistent with a partially rehydrated sample related to compound 1.
